title: Mac- League of legends quit unexpectedly
body:
So basically I've been playing league, but while trying to go back to my computer account, it displays "League Of Legends quit unexpectedly" 
Then it continues to display a bunch of text and numbers, 
here's what I tried so far:
-I tried to reopen multiple times
-I restarted my computer
-I changed the user kernel

(No, prior to this I haven't messed with any of the files, but I'm hoping to find a fix that doesn't involve re-downloading the whole game as it takes a terribly long time and i've heard that doesn't fix it for some people with the same problem.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body: What version of macOS (OS X) are you running? I've heard of similar issues on some older versions of the OS, but I'll need to know which version you're running.

Gotcha. So where specifically is this happening? You mentioned that it was when you're trying to get back into your computer account, but I'll need to you expand on that a bit more so I can understand what's going on.

Oh yeah for sure, I might've been unclear. Before this started occurring, the league client would be left open when my family members would switch to their other mac accounts, so I'm not sure if that forces it to shut down. Anyhow, now it just happens when i click it in the task bar and that's when the message appears, and I've attempted to open it through the applications in finder. But yeah just clicking the icon makes the message pop.

Edit: plot twist, it opens if I find it through the applications folder in finder, the message will display occasionally, but it still refuses to open on the sidebar (where the other programs are located).

Does the message ever pop up if you launch League from the Applications Folder? It's recommended you launch League from the Applications folder, as it ensures that League is launching correctly and can properly access assets inside your installation folder.

it's only happened once or twice, but it's a bit of a hassle to reach the applications folder, i have a lot of files so the load up is slow, but at the side bar it used to open fine, now it doesn't sadly//

I know this thread is kinda old, but something that worked for me was to go into the Applications folder and make an alias of the League of Legends program, and put the alias in the hotbar. This is way easier than going into the Applications folder every time and has worked pretty well for me.

> [{quoted}](name=Tydiel,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=0nvcP71W,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2017-09-01T20:40:57.135+0000)
>
> I know this thread is kinda old, but something that worked for me was to go into the Applications folder and make an alias of the League of Legends program, and put the alias in the hotbar. This is way easier than going into the Applications folder every time and has worked pretty well for me.

Dude thanks so much with that alias tip and the applications folder tips as well for the guys above you. i reset my entire mac to factory settings and was redownloading league and it was at 75% last time i had it on and my computer crashed and it wouldn't open again {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

> [{quoted}](name=Aruamanic,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=0nvcP71W,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-10-20T22:07:25.191+0000)
>
> Dude thanks so much with that alias tip and the applications folder tips as well for the guys above you. i reset my entire mac to factory settings and was redownloading league and it was at 75% last time i had it on and my computer crashed and it wouldn't open again {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Yes, Opening from application works.
I think some issue mac mac caching a previously crashed version in finder and trying to open it instead of reloading the client from scratch.

Please help me ive tried to launch it from the applications folder but it still quit
 automatically
OMG THAT WORKED FOR ME LOL THANKS!!!{{champion:245}}
